member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.EndPointAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the URL fragment parsed by this union case. Example: type Action = | [<EndPoint "/article">] GetArticle

member.name: M:WebSharper.Sitelets.FormDataAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Indicates that the union case arguments with the given names must be parsed from the request's query parameters. Example: type Action = | [<FormData "someField">] MyAction of someField: string

member.name: M:WebSharper.Sitelets.FormDataAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Indicates that a field must be parsed from the request's query parameters. Example: type Action = { [<FormData>] someField: string }

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.FormDataAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a field or union case argument must be parsed from the request's body in form post syntax, ie. with the Content-Type being either application/x-www-form-urlencoded or multipart/form-data. The value must be a primitive value, a DateTime, or an option thereof.

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.HttpHandler
member.summary: The ISS handler for WebSharper applications.

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.HttpModule
member.summary: IIS module, processing the URLs and serving the pages.

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.IWebsite`1
member.summary: Define a Sitelets website. This interface must be implemented by the type passed to WebsiteAttribute.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Sitelets.JsonAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Indicates that the union case argument with the given name must be parsed from the request's body as JSON. Example: type Action = | [<Json "data">] MyAction of data: MyData

member.name: M:WebSharper.Sitelets.JsonAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Indicates that a field must be parsed from the request's body as JSON. Example: type Action = { [<Json>] data : MyData }

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.JsonAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a field or a union case argument must be parsed from the request body as JSON, rather than from the URL path.

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.Location
member.summary: Represents addressable locations.

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.MethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a union case in an action type must only be mapped for requests that use the given HTTP method(s). Example: type Action = | [<Method "POST">] MyPostAction

member.name: F:WebSharper.Sitelets.WebSharper.Sitelets.Page.Body
member.summary: Body of the page, ie. contents of the <body> tag.

member.name: F:WebSharper.Sitelets.WebSharper.Sitelets.Page.Head

member.summary: Title of the page, ie. contents of the <title> tag.

member.name: F:WebSharper.Sitelets.WebSharper.Sitelets.Page.Doctype
member.summary: Doctype tag. Default is the standard HTML5 doctype: "<!DOCTYPE html>"

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.Sitelet`1
member.summary: Represents a self-contained website parameterized by the type of actions. A sitelet combines a router, which is used to match incoming requests to actions and actions to URLs, and a controller, which is used to handle the actions.

member.summary: Mark a static property or module-bound value representing a Sitelets website. The value must have type Sitelet<'T>.

member.summary: Mark an assembly that contains a Sitelets website. The type passed must implement IWebsite.

member.summary: Mark an assembly that contains a Sitelets website, or a Sitelet static property.

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.ActionEncoding
member.summary: Implements generic URL encoding and decoding for algebraic datatypes. To be on the safe side, the encoded values use only unreserved URL characters (including alphanumeric, tilde, dash, underscore and dot characters). Tilde serves as a special character starting escape sequences. The encoding also uses the forward slash to separate logical components.

member.name: M:WebSharper.Sitelets.Content.Template`1.#ctor(System.String,WebSharper.Sitelets.Content.Template.LoadFrequency)

member.summary: Constructs a new template from an XML file at a given path.

member.name: T:WebSharper.Sitelets.Content.Template`1
member.summary: Defines a new page template. Template files are parsed as XML and then analyzed for placeholders. There are text placeholders ${foo} that can appear inside text nodes and attributes, and node or node-list placeholders such as <div data-hole="bar"> or <div data-replace="bar">. Node placeholder elements get completely replaced (data-replace), or get their contents replaced (data-hole) during expansion. This mechanism allows to populate placeholders with example content and validate templates as HTML5 during development.

member.summary: A type of HTML elements.
